review: Worse service.  Sat at bar waiting for 10 minutes while two bartenders ran their mouths and totally ignored me and the other people that came in.  Spoke to the manager Brian and he offered  nothing more than I would talk to them.  He showed no concern for his service.

Horrible experience. I will never come to this location again. Our server rarely checked on us. Another server accidentally dropped ranch all over the floor and under our table, which wasn't a huge deal until our waitress came over and sighed while looking at us implying we made the mess. I kindly stated that we did not make the mess, and that another server had dropped it. Our drinks were not once replenished. We had to ask another waiter for our second round of "endless apps"...which we didn't receive. It was a complete mess and a waste of $50+.
The service is substandard. After several failed visits, I have decided to let them practice running an establishment at the expense of another patron. I will not patronize this location again!
Captive audience at the hotel next door.  Ultra slow service and overcharged.  Took forever to correct the bill.  Stay away.

It's Friday's...what do you expect? A mediocre location of a mediocre chain. Food is, well, the stuff on Friday's menu: burgers, ribs, steaks,  a few salads, and the bar-food appetizers. (A few trendy small plates thrown in too.) Strong drinks.  This location is moderately clean and has spotty service: some servers are attentive and knowledgeable...others really aren't. I come back mostly when my wife suggests it. Nothing special, nothing terrible.

I don't hate TGI Fridays, nor do I love it. I'm generally impartial as far as chain restaurants go as I know what to expect. I've been to this location a few times over the past few years and had decent service, but they've since changed their menu and have removed a lot of the lighter options (wraps). It's never been great, but it's definitely gotten worse. All of our food was drenched in grease and oils, to the point the hamburger buns were so thoroughly soaked they were dissolving. When you're eating and notice giant globular pools of grease forming in your food it's rather off-putting and turns you off from eating. Our waitress was a bit of a mix. One of my companions ordered their "unlimited" appetizers, but was told right off the board that if he shares one (or we take one) she has to stop serving him completely. Are potato skins THAT important that they need to come with a disclaimer you're going to stop serving us if somebody liberates an appetizer? If I'm paying for his unlimited appetizer and I take one why are we punished? She later came back and told us that her manager was encouraging them to be the food police, but that felt rather awkward. Order a meal, get a warning! At least the warning was complimentary. My wife wanted to try their chicken salad, but it came with cranberries (she's not a fan of 'em). We asked if it was possible to have the cranberries removed and were told it's pre-made, and then our waitress added she's not going to personally remove the cranberries from our order. Uh, okay? We didn't ask you to do that, but that's good to know. In short: bad service, overly greasy, oily food. I figure my pictures can speak for themselves. Disappointment level: chartreuse.

Ribs with shrimps tasted very good. Desserts were also good. However, the bathroom was too nasty....i came in and there was a toilet that got stuck and overthrown with shit all over the place...the whole bathroom smelled like shit. Totally ruined my mood for the night and my appetite. At least put a notice on the door or get a crew to clean it up right away. But no..the door was left open and nasty! Would have given 4 stars but the nasty scene ruined my taste and mood

Food order was messed up. Food was okay. Went here for my son's birthday because he loves the TGIF birthday song. They chose not to do the song even though we told them, but I guess they keep the celebrations for special people only, and he did not count as one.  A disappointed son and average food. Can forgive them for the latter but not the former, we will not be coming back.
Best TGIF I have been to! Good service.Food tastes better than at Tysons corner.Will go back again!

Being so close to work I will occasionally find myself at Fridays for lunch. It's always easy to pick something out, they have a big menu and lots of it sounds really good. For the most part, in my experiences, the food never lives up to the pictures or descriptions from the menu. It's all passable and that's really my overall opinion of the food.  I can't speak to the drinks or bar atmosphere as I'm always here during work hours.

This Friday's getting worse and worse. We used to come here at least once a month, foods were ok, service was ok. This time it made me never want to come back again. No silverware, fries are very salty, flatbread is like a wet sponge, the kids fruit plate missing ingredients... Anyway, nothing goes right here. Service is as bad as a Chinese restaurant.

Server Sean was nice but the guy name Farhad at the bar acting like an asshole; just ask for a lime which is not going inside the bottle because it's too big and when I asked he was so upset about it; he was yelling the other side of the bar.He needs to be out of there.

Things started out great when my iced tea arrived shortly after ordering it. However, the food was not good. The appetizer was the BBQ Chicken Flatbread. This was not very warm, and was slightly soggy on the bottom. The main course was the Salmon and Lobster. There was a distinct odor from the plate, though I could not find the source. Most of the lobster was fine, but three pieces were cold, not just not warm.

Friday's is always great! Best happy hour ever!  However, this location is the most boring location I've ever been to. It's so quiet in there you almost feel as though you have to whisper. I've been going to Friday's ALL OVER since I was a teenager, and I've never experienced one so boring. I frequent this location a lot because it's the closest to my house & the happy hour deals of course. But, it needs some serious flair & QUICK!  On one of our experiences there was a large group of us at the BAR, and the older male waiter that works there literally yelled at us for being too loud. Have you ever heard of a quiet bar?  Lately we've been trying to sit outdoors so we don't feel so uncomfortable. If the Bar Louie across the street had a longer happy hour we'd surely go there instead. I really wish the best for this location, but upper management has to come in to help them out ASAP!!!

My favorite item on the menu is the pretzels with cheesy bacon dip, it's got bacon bit in the cheese! So delicious! The atmosphere has that bar style feeling with custom art work on the walls, the center of the restaurant is the bar, and the staff is friendly. Nothing too special about it, but if you're looking for a late night bite and a good deal on food I recommend it. They frequent put on new specials with their entrees and appetizers, the pretzels I mentioned in the beginning are an appetizer. The location of this one is convenient, right next to a theater and other shops.

If I could give negative  stars I would! This place is HORRIBLE!  I'm a college student and I went there with some friends and none of the servers would serve us.... Even when we complained to the host. This was so unprofessional and rude to be honest! The waiter who had our table kept skipping over us and served people who were arriving after us so we left. I'll never go there again! I even asked one of the waitresses who I had went to highschool with why any wouldn't serve us and she said because they thought we wouldn't tip! I was baffled! I cannot believe they have people like this working for them! Definitely calling corporate!

I just ordered out the ribs with the extra lobster on top using the online ordering.  Got home to eat, and they forgot to put the lobster on my order.  Asked them to refund the lobster instead, but the call took forever just to talk to the manager.  Little discrepancies like these will turn repeat customers away.

Great happy hour deals on cocktails AND food! People under rate this place. The restaurant looks neat the staff is super nice and the food is great. Tried the meatball , tuna and a third appetizer as well. Definitely recommend for a night out in herndon or an afterwork.
Been here a few times. Their Jack Daniels burger is always really good.

For the most part this is a pretty typical Fridays location, with the exception of the service which is significantly below par and really hampers the entire experience. The restaurant itself is clean with totally acceptable decor. The food consists mostly of American bar food and it's mostly solid if uninspired. I will mention that the burgers tend to be pretty low quality given their cost, I would be hesitant to get any burgers or steaks here. The biggest issue is that the service at this location is just incredibly slow. Everything from taking our orders to getting our food out to bringing us our checks takes longer than it should, especially considering there were fewer than a dozen customers in the entire restaurant. It makes for a really frustrating experience when you're just trying to get a quick bite to eat during your lunch hour and it takes 10+ minutes after you sit down to even see your waitress. If you have a lot of time to kill and are craving some fried bar food, then maybe give Fridays a shot. Otherwise there are better options out there.

You can use Samsung pay at this restaurant. But you need to explain a little bit. They don't know what's difference between Samsung pay and Apple pay and they will say Samsung pay and Apple pay not working. You need to explain Samsung pay will work almost everywhere and Apple pay is not.

If I could give this zero stars I would.   Do NOT go here during lunch time, especially if you do not have a two hour break.   My spouse and I ordered a Diet Coke and ONE appetizer.  It took 45 minutes for it to come out!  We never got any check in or apologies from the waitress.  We wanted to order more food but never got the opportunity and after an hour and half of sitting there we had to get back to work.    The table behind us waited even longer and eventually asked for their food to go when it did  finally come out after hour.    Horrible customer service.   Horrible wait.   Horrible experience.   Stay away from this location. Here's a picture of our food! Just kidding it's the empty table we looked at for an hour

We live near Worldgate & want to add some of the eateries to our Saturday night date night rotation. Since Charlie Changs  closed, not much there that appeals to my guy. He'd seen the ads for ribs at TGIF, tho, and wanted to give that a try. (Those ribs look darn good.) We got there about 5:30pm on Sat. Not too crowded & we asked if we would get served at the bar since we wanted to watch college football. The host showed us to a bar table & said, "Your server will be right with you." Fifteen minutes later I went down to the host desk & told him no one had been by. He was very apologetic - could not have been nicer - & assured us someone would be right with us. About 5 minutes later we saw him talking to a man in another area. Tables in that area were being served. The host actually pointed to us, saying something we couldn't hear - presumably, "They want to place their order..." - the man nodded, turned & went into the kitchen & we never saw him again, Another 5 minutes & husband said, "Let's go. Houlihan's is just across the street & we know we'll get served there." I couldn't argue. Clearly we weren't going to get served. So we walked by the host stand. He was talking to someone & didn't see us.  Guess we'll have to find a Ruby Tuesday's for ribs. PS - Houlilhan's makes a great Southwest Chicken wrap - had one Sat night...:)
Food was great so was service. Ask for Vania, she's the best server. 5 Stars all day long
Great specials but super slow service. Came on a slow, rainy weekday but staff was inattentive and our food and drinks took forever to come. Will not be returning anytime soon.

I came here with a few friends in October and we just had a few drinks/appetizers. Service was quick and friendly. Drink specials were pretty good and the food specials were not that bad either. This is definitely a good spot to go to before exploring the Worldgate plaza or before a movie night. The patio is nice on a warm night and the bar has plenty of TVs for any sports night. I'd definitely recommend for big gatherings looking for a chill atmosphere!

They served refried chicken wings to my party. One of my guest chicken was half raw! My colleagues and I just walked out. This was the worst TGI Fidays ever! Save your money go to Wendy's, Burger King hell McDonald's or Chuck E. Cheese's they have superior for and it won't kill you!
I come here all the time, and I Gotta say this fridays beats all other fridays I've been to, food is always delicious and customer service is always welcoming

Possibly the worst experience at a TGI Fridays. I went there for my lunch break ( i only get 1 hour) ordered my food and drink. I waited 40 minutes after i ordered to ask them to put my food in a box  since it didnt look like it was coming anytime soon. i had no time to eat in there due to them taking so long. After that i still had to wait for them to bring my food.

The 3 stars I gave is soley based on food as service has always been great. Ribs are always good even when I order them plain. However, I had substituted onion rings instead of the fries. For an up charge, I only got three below average sized onion rings?? It tasted like it was frozen and refried a few times. Just AWFUL. Also, the free chips and salsa needs improving. They're stale tasting and salsa is very bland.

Came here late on Valentines Day because there wasn't any that's open late near us.  When we first walked in it took awhile for a host to seat us so we had to wait until someone seats us. Not happy at all. Anyways Me and my BF decided to eat here and I ordered lobster w/ salmon includes with two sides which I ordered the mac and cheese and rice. My boyfriend ordered grilled steak with mashed potatoes and some fries. Took awhile for our food to come out but but it was all worth it my salmon was fresh and juicy, rice was a bit cold. The grilled steak my BF ordered was pretty good.  Not the best TGI Fridays but I'll  come back if I was near this place.

3 Stars  Honestly a mixed bag  The waiter was really trying to do a good job, but he wasn't getting much help. Paul got his entree before I could even get a side salad. Food was okay, but it tasted like everything was saturated in butter. I had a mixed drink too that was excellent. I rarely drink. Couldn't taste the alcohol but had a nice kick.

Had a wonderful experience with our server. Food came out quickly. Was going to order more until I saw a cockroach crawl up the wall. Told the server then took the manager 10 minutes to come out and address the issue he apologized. Had to wait another 10 minutes for the server to come out only to have the manager take 10.00 off of the bill. The bill  total was about 40. Guess being calm in a  situation doesn't make the experience better Used to come here all the time. Probably will not be back.  So glad a bug problem was treated as a priority

Our visit to this TGI Fridays began going downhill when, minutes after being seated, we spotted a mouse running across the floor towards the kitchen. We spoke to a manager, who apologized, told us that they use a weekly preventative for mice, and said that he would cover our check if we chose to stay. We decided to risk it. The food was good, but the service was lacking. My coworker's appetizers (he ordered the endless apps) came out after meals were served and, despite placing an immediate order for an appetizer refill, that refill didn't come out. After a long time, he wound up ordering a third appetizer, which came out before the second one...it was all very confusing. My other coworker had to ask multiple times for a simple box to package up her food. Everything was just really slow; it took us 90 minutes to have a very simple lunch. Then, the kicker, when we got our check, they didn't comp it after all. They took 50% off, but that wasn't what we'd been told would happen. It probably seems ridiculous to complain about 50% off, and I honestly wouldn't have complained if that's what we'd been told was going to happen. It just seems like really poor customer service to state one thing to get us to stay and then do something different. And, we didn't order gratuitously - we all had water, and, in total, the table's order was just 1 endless apps & 1 normal entree. We won't be returning.

Service was  horrible! !. Over priced  us. Chicken was dry. I ordered one thing received  another. Went 3 times took 30 minutes  to place an order she laughed and said opps i forgot about you guys. I hate the fact that this is the only one close by. I drive for good service to manassas or tyson mall.  My friends hated waiting 25 minutes  for a beer Each time. Just plan horrible!

Third time visiting our local Fridays and each time we've had excellent drinks. I am a professional chef and I enjoy the happy hour drinks and food, burgers are on point too. Have not dined in so cannot vouch for dinner service. So far the bar rocks  keep it up bartenders .

I enjoy TGI Fridays for their massive selection of appetizers and long list of sides.  I only give three stars for this particular location because of problems with the facility.  The store is smaller than it looks so when it's full you're going to be knocking into people at the tables.  The rear section and the bar are several steps higher than the front end and you're rather uncomfortably close to the ceiling.  The ambient lighting is bad because the LED lamps in the restaurant and in the outside seating are randomly pulsing brighter and darker, making the dining experience somewhat psychedelic.  An electrician should pay them a courtesy visit and advise some corrective changes. In the front end of the store the fully upholstered chairs are a tight fit for adult males. For that reason I recommend sitting in the regular padded chairs, booths, and stools.  I have observed the service bar window staff have trouble with the POS equipment on more than one visit, but on a recent visit I see that the POS system has been upgraded to a fancy tablet which is running much more smoothly. I love their food.  It's not heavy and not salty which is a good combination.  The salads are a nice, low-fat, low-calorie alternative after you enjoy the appetizers.  The Million Dollar Cobb salad is only $11 and comes with grilled chicken, making it an excellent and healthy choice, with a very delicious take on the new Green Goddess dressing concept.  It's a true Cobb salad. I should note that I formerly recommended instead visiting the Fairfax location but after my recent visit in Herndon I can say this location has improved, but I still recommend avoiding the tiny upholstered chairs in the front (there are fewer now, replaced with regular wooden, padded chairs).  The Jack Daniels Sampler appetizer is spectacular and I also recommend the half-rack of ribs with Jack Daniels sauce and a spinach side.  The Sampler has a 1/3 rack from what we can tell.  If your party has a ribs lover get them a half rack and get the rest of your party the Sampler.  You will all be happy.
Love coming here ! Jorge is my favorite manager , he makes everything go by smooth and makes sure my food is 100% great ! Thanks Friday's
Its ok, but not great. just ok, food was fair, but a lot of oil on the food. staff was nice, just not great food.

We were craving for easy lunch. TGIF was the answer. Had sizzling chicken n shrimp and brownies. So good... Our server, Destiny, was attentive & helped me decide to get the dessert. Lol Anyways, it was so good. Happy...
Jack Daniel's Burger is amazing. Well-medium is highly recommended with fries.

New local favorite of mine.   Farhan and Kate are the only two bartenders I know by name but  all of them seem to do a good job.  Can't beat the alcohol prices.  I'd recommend this spot as long as you're not a snobby douche bag.

Our experience at TGIF Herndon, VA. Sat, Oct 3, from 6:05-7:20pm. Waited 45 mins before appetizers and kids food arrived.  Waiter said our food order got bumped because of two large parties that had come in.  our steaks hadn't been done yet, and we had to leave for movie, so we asked waiter to stop order and put back in for after movie.  He said fine, we paid bill, but then the manager came to table and said steaks were done.  when i explained that we had to leave for movie, had been waiting for over 45 mins at that point, and had already arranged with waiter, she was unhappy.  she said 'well, your food is ready now.  just take it to go."  I told her I didn't want to do that since we were already late and then our food would be sitting in our car for two hours and she rolled her eyes and walked away.  My kids asked me why the lady was mad at mommy.  the other 2 adults besides myself were shocked at her attitude as well.  my waiter apologized and assured me he would take care of us.  so we left.  after movie, we returned and he brought the food to me to go in less than 5 mins.  he assured that he had doubled checked the food and sides himself and again apologized.  he made excuse for manager, saying she was frustrated with kitchen, but she didn't come out herself.  our food was barely warm, so it probably did just sit there under lamps for two hours anyway.   Bottom line, we were disgusted with the manager and she ruined our experience with TGIFridays (normally a place we like to go).  We've never gone to the Herndon location before and don't know that we'll ever try one again.  The manager's name was Natalie and she royally sucked.  She should not be in a position of authority, let alone in customer service. Caleb, our waiter, should have her job.  He handled himself well, accepted my complaint and tried to make it right.  I am very disappointed in TGIF Herndon (save our waiter, Caleb).  Oh, and my "10oz steak with lobster topping" was about 4oz with the tiniest little lobster bits I've ever seen.  Bonus!! -Adrienne

Food is over-salted and too spicy. Jack Danniels burger tastes like piece of salt I even can feel how it crack on my teeth. However managers reacted really fast and personnel are very nice. So if salt proportion will be fixed - it will be nice place to visit.

Had a really great dinner at this restaurant. I felt that the staff was very welcoming,friendly and accurate as they took care of our orders. Have not been here since the mid 1990's. it was moderately not crowded

I and a friend stopped by yesterday before seeing the movie called Lucy, and ordered drinks and snacks from Matt.  I had the yummy Thai Pork Tacos, and the huge tasty wedge salad.  My friend had the Parmesan-Crusted Chicken All-natural chicken served with cheddar mac & cheese and a side of fresh tomato & mozzarella salad. See you again Matt -- you made the experience rather nice.

Do you have time to kill? Are you waiting for your arteries to harden? Are you trying to hide away until next years calender is released? Well this is the place for you! Here at tgif fridays our food is so natural you have to wait for us to raise a cow from birth until the day we can serve it to you! Want a salad instead? Woah now! Youre going to need to wait till the lettuce seedling starts to grow! Seriously, this restaurants kitchen is slow. Its beyond slow. There isnt an adjective to describe how slow. We ended up getting our food to go bc they were backed up and it was missing portions of the meal! Unless you got a couple hours to kill in a freezing cold and customer service deprived establishment I would skip this place and go watch your computer defragment instead!

Sign up for their stripes card and immediately get a coupon for free appetizer or dessert. Happy hour is practically all day long, cheap drinks and cheap food. What else can I ask for.  I like to drench the Jack Daniel sauce over everything. It is extremely addicting! The food is good for the area, what can I say? It is Friday's, not some Jean Georges restaurant. Reasonable price, friendly staff and good food.
One star rating should be reserved for the truly upsetting. This is just depressing.  Only if you have to. Seriously.

Where to start? I LOVE Fridays.. I always hear negative things about Fridays but its really one of my favorite places!!  It was love at first taste about 8 years ago when I got a job as a hostess at the Sterling location.  Although my job only last a year, my love for Fridays has lived on!! Since the Sterling location closed Herndon is the next best location. Food: They have a variety of appetizers such as pot stickers, wings, spinach artichoke dip, tostado nachos, spicy queso,  hummus etc..Their main courses such as cajun shrimp pasta, flat iron steak, caribbean chicken sandwich, sizzling chicken and cheese, and any of the Jack Daniels options(chicken, steak and burger) are DELICIOUS!! Happy Hour: M-F 4-9pm Offers $2 domestic drafts, $3 imported and $4 margaritas, mojitos and long islands. From 4-Close they offer select half price appetizers and after 9pm they have select $5burgers Fridays Rewards: its free to sign up and is awesome to have if you are a repeat customer like me. One point for every dollar you spend which you can later redeem for free food.  Also make your to ask for the free rewards chips..theyre unlimited and yummy! The service there is hit or miss.  One server who does stick out for great customer service and friendliness is a guy named Matt! Make sure to request him! Last but not least...Stop being stingy with the fries when you order burger or sandwiches especially the sweet potato fries(if you notice in my pic, i got about a handful).. NOT COOL!
Worst Friday's in the world and I've been to them all over the world. Bad food bad service bad clientele bad atmosphere.

TGIF might want to simplify their coupons and deals since it seems to confuse staff at this restaurant. Went here because we had printed out one of their many email coupons. Our waitress told us about the refillable appetizers and some other menu deal. We showed her the coupon we had and asked if the coupon would be valid if we ordered any of the things she mentioned. I know that some of the time Fridays does not combine coupons and menu deals which is why I asked. The waitress took the coupon and went to ask someone and when she came back she told us it was ok. We ordered our food and everything was good. Finished up and asked for the check and it seemed to take a long while. Then a blond haired manager comes over and starts giving us a hard time about how the coupon couldn't be combined with what were ordered, blah blah blah. And I told her that we had asked the waitress if it was ok before we ever ordered anything but go ahead and add whatever to the bill and I'll pay it. She said she went ahead and put the coupon on the check which made me wonder why she was even over there talking to us. If we are getting what we expected to on the bill then their is no problem for us and no reason for a manager to approach us and gave us a hard time. It was nice of her to give us the coupon even though the waitress had told us it was fine. But, we had just finished a nice meal and really didn't need to hear the stuff she was saying. If the waitress or the person the waitress talked to made a mistake, tell them. Not me. I don't work for you and really don't need to hear it. If the coupons are that complicated then come up with a better system. Was def a bad ending to a dinner And now we never go anymore. Anytime it's suggested we say no and decide on a different place.

Party time party time party time. When it is Friday it is a lot of fun here and energy is up, and it doesn't have to just be a Friday. I always found the food here to be so so all those are the fun experience and the staff is always nice. The service was quite slow and forgetful of us. Location is nice being that is in Worldgate however as I said another reviews of mine I don't like the side of the freeway that it's on as it can tend to be hey little bit lower income and lower class with several sketchy people coming in. It was a fun environment here and enjoy the buzz that you can fill in the air. There's also a bar and some happy hours if you're interested.

The workers here are the worst I've ever seen. When she brought food our almost spilt it because she has a sucker in her other hand. And when we arrived a worker sat there in a chair for 5 min reading instead of seating us

Terrible place to dine. Been there twice with a group of of 10 people. Both time we placed our orders within 15 minutes of arriving, waited 1 hour and 15 minutes for our food to come out. The places wasn't even packed. I blame management for this awful service!!!! Don't waste your time going here...

Well let me mention this is my first time going to Happy Hour here and it wasn't too bad. Not as noisy as I expected it to be and that was great. Met a nice old man who sat beside me at the bar and I couldn't understand a dang thing he was saying but it was a toast everytime the Washington Nationals were up to bat. Nice and relaxing waiting for my Channing to join me. I feel out of sorts without him. Wait staff could be more attentive.
This has been our go to spot for drinks and late night eats since its so close to home. The service is always great and the bartender is generous with the adult beverages.

These reviews for Friday's are hilarious.  They have good food, good cocktails, and good service. Yes, it's a chain, but it's a good addition to Worldgate. I think people should probably check their expectations just a bit, lol. Check out the happy hour deals during the week.  They're amazing.  Oh, and sign up for a loyalty card, it's worth it.  *Bonus, this place is kid friendly.

I like the casual atmosphere of these places...in fact, one of our favorite local places is Glory Days. Today, I drop by here for a beer after working out. We come in the door and the hostess is chatting it up with a male customer...no acknowledgement that a human being is standing 3 feet away. After several minutes of this I say excuse me...she just walks away. WTF  Maybe my fault for going out to Friday's on Friday the 13.

I come here often for happy hour with my colleagues. Happy hour specials great and crowds okay. Limited bar space since the place gets packed during happy hour and sucks they don't extend the special outside of bar area. Staff are okay, could be more friendly in my opinion.

Did not have a good time here tonight! Our server sara was late to take our order, late to bring us our food, didn't refill any drinks, was literally nowhere to be seen........I asked for no tomatoes in my burger and when I finally got my burger it was cold with a tomato... didn't want to ask for another burger because it'd probably be late and cold.... when I asked for new fries... took 15 mins to get new fries....... so pissed! Didn't even get a refill of our drinks without having to look around the restaurant and asking  she looked like she couldn't handle the amount of tables she had...
I don't think they know the meat cut. Apparently NY strip is the new rib eye! So stupid!

I Will never come to this place again. This was really empty in a Wednesday night, what would mean quick and nice service, but no really. Took a while to the waiter get to us and then we ordered drinks and omg, the worst margarita I've ever had in all my life, extremely strong that I couldn't even drink.  We decide to order sesame chicken strips and was delicious, but they didn't bring even a napkin, so we asked the waitress for some fork and she just brought 2 napkins and 2 plates, I HAD TO EAT WITH MY HANDS. Don't waste your time, is very expensive and there is good restaurants around here, I regret every second not going to Louie Bar right across the street, they have amazing drinks and food.

Came here for a date night and it was close to our home being new paranoid parents. Haven't been here in decades and I can see why. The service was very slow and lacking. The server we had was just very unfriendly and slow. We both decided to have mojitos and I might as well had water with mint. It was so watered down it was disgusting. I had the burger which was pretty good I give it a 3 and hubby had the rib eye which was a 3 as well. All in all I just hope the service improves with the drinks. I don't know if we will be back.

Worst experience at this location at about 11pm. I came in with my boyfriend to celebrate his 22nd birthday with a few drinks. We got a booth nearby the bar and our waitress was fine. We both ordered a 3$ beer right after our arrival and I just decided to get up and go to the restroom. Another customer came into the bathroom while I was already getting situated in the stall. She burst open my stall and told me to "hurry the f***" up" when I was putting toilet paper down so I could sit down comfortably. This customer sexually harassed me and saw me with my pants down ready to use the bathroom. I left the bathroom and told her I was going to complain. I complained to the hostress. The service fuckin sucks. Last i checked, it doesnt take 20 minutes to bring a glass of water. Also the steak was flavorless without the sauce. My dog eats better steak than what this place serves. Best bar staff ever. I always look forward to seeing them every day .Very friendly and funny people. They always have my drink ready when they see me. Food is always good
NEVER COME HERE ON A SATURDAY AFTERNOON BETWEEN THE HOURS OF 1230pm - Probably until 5.... Service is slow and staff does not communicate the reason for it. Very unprofessional.

The Reptilian Prince was not pleased with the dreadful waiting. I shall bring my army from the North to put down this foul restaurant into oblivion. I was not greeted nor treated like the prince I am.  As the Reptilian Prince, I warn the citizens of Herndon.  Hissssssssssss~

Where do I start. Table of two, not busy 1. Watched our server put his fingers in the inside of the glasses he was serving 2. Took 5+ minutes to get our drinks 3. When we did get our drinks:  A. Bartender did not know how to make a Gin Ricky, and the attempt at one was awful straight gin!  B. New speciality cocktail, watermelon something   Sour and no garnish. Food arrived: poor not up to standard 7 no QC 8. Had to wait additional 15min to get out of here while we waited for server to bring check!!!! Save your money, this is disappointing, can't count on the chain to be consistent :-(

10 people 1 server A combination for a horrible evening.  We came here thinking we would get better service than at the understaffed hotel restaurant across the street were we were staying at ,we were wrong. At first they attempted to seat all of us in a booth????? I saw the area closest to the restrooms empty and asked if we could have that area instead,  The greater obliged. The section for some reason had the heater on ? it's mid August they sent someone over and turned it off. Our server was polite and very nice but in this instance , I feel management drop the ball, The place wasn't busy, other servers could've helped our servers or at least anyone else there in an attempt to provide appropriate service to a party our size. Our bill was $150 but could have easily been $300 but due to the slow service wasn't,  we were tired of waiting. My sister ordered the fish it was painfully dry and I literally, not figuratively, started choking on it coughing after she offered me a bite to show me how terrible it was (picture bacon fish) I don't expect five-star food when coming to Friday's or top-notch service although I have received excellent service at another. I Want decent service. I don't blame the staff here, this place is poorly managed, perhaps a visit to the Leesburg location would be appropriate for this manager.

Good/Okay/better than expected. Typical TGI Fridays.  Nothing outstanding to say. Staff is okay. Food okay. Side portions are very small but tasty. Medium steak is closer to rare. Bar counter clean but the Printer at bar is well.....needs to be replaced or drastically cleaned.

This location has gone down hill and I will no longer be dining here. First of all, our waiter didn't do a very good job of waiting. I'm not expecting a high class experience but it took at least 15 minutes before my boyfriend and I were even asked what We wanted to drink. The waiter never checked up on the food once we actually got it. My burger was so greasy/bloody it leaked all over the plate, as shown in my picture. Items I asked to NOT be in my burger (like pickles) were in my burger and I had to pick them out. It even took a long time to get the check after it was asked for.  My previous visit here was bad as well. At that time my order took quite long to receive because the kitchen lost / misplaced the gluten free buns. By the time my food arrived, the rest of my party (my boyfriend) was 1/2 way through his meal when he discovered a long hair in his burger. At least the manager came by and comped his meal for the hairy experience.  This location used to be much better. I don't know wtf happened? It's very disappointing and I hope they change things around for the better.

Wow ... Absolutely disgusting! I first ordered the Jack Daniels ribs and shrimp. The ribs were awful, I could taste freezer burn in the meat. I sent them back and decided to go a bit more classic and simpler: the sizzling chicken and shrimp. Let's just say the 5 shrimp in the side was lunch for me. The chicken was uncooked, pink and raw! The ended up taking it off my tab however I left their with an unsatisfied appetite & a hunger that wasn't cured!

Best TGI Friday's I've ever been to! My service has been wonderful. I chose the recommended berry mojito mixer cocktail and it was delicious. The manager Natale is extremely outgoing and made sure my dining experience was up to par. Bartender was also kind and gave good recommendations. For dinner, I opted for the Jack Daniels flat-Iron steak and shrimp with fresh broccoli and mashed potatoes. The steak came out perfect and I'm very satisfied with my experience at this location. Will be coming back in the near future!

So I have to admit I went to Fridays last night after my bestie begged me. For the past 3 years I haven't even given this restaurant chain a second glance. Poor food and worse service at so many various locations taught me a lesson:Avoid Fridays-Be Happy! However the Herndon location definitely made me satisfied and actually looking forward to another visit. First off, their happy hour -food and beverages are shockingly inexpensive! I can remember my last Friday's meal being overpriced and unappealing. So I ordered a fresh strawberry daiquiri and it lived up to its name! It was light, very fresh and a thirst quencher.Good deal! We also ordered potstickers as a shared appetizer . They come 6 to an order and while they weren't amazing -they were pretty good. An easy appetizer before the grand finale! So I skimmed the menu but I generally order the same entrees from my past visits. This time was no different -I ordered the chicken tenders (yes I'm an adult of 25 years old-please don't judge me ) and subbed the fries for loaded mashed potatoes. Wow! They were better than I remember - the chicken was incredibly hot and fresh-the potatoes were warm with melted cheddar , real bacon, and chives-yum! And you can't visit a Fridays without a side of Jack Daniels sauce. I cleared my plate! My best friend ordered her usual-Jack Daniels Fried Shrimp entree and loaded mashed potatoes as well. I will be returning in the near future to test if this really is an exceptional location or if last night was just a really good night for them!

I've been to Fridays more times then I can count. The food is always decent. The atmosphere is always lively and fun. However, my most recent trip to the Herndon location was aweful. I went there for lunch with the family and were seated right away. Thats the only thing that went right. An hour should be more then enough time to eat lunch but the service was SO slow. It wasnt even busy and it took forever for our server to even greet our table.  We ordered an appetizer and that took 20 mins for some reason. Drinks were never filled and we had to search on another table for napkins and silverware. We ended up getting the entrees to go bc our server was slow as molasses. Id only reccomend if you feel like going for lunch and having dinner instead.

We attempted eating at Friday's this evening after taking a few years off. We were amazingly unimpressed. To start off our family was seated in the seat NO one wants to sit in, the one right next to the bathroom. We had a server that couldn't have cared less about our table. It was some of the worst service we have had at any restaurant. We ordered 2 appetizers since we had small children with us and would have enjoyed eating something early. After about 20 minutes, our server brought out our ENTREES and no appetizers.  We asked about the appetizers and he just shrugged and asked what we ordered. The food was less than desirable. Two people at the table ordered the Jack Chicken and Shrimp meal for $17 each. The chicken was barely 4oz and the 6 sad looking shrimp appeared to have been microwaved. The Parmesan fries were soggy and the sauce was not pleasant. Additionally, the broccoli that was provided was a just one large piece, barely cooked, and not cut up. Just a chunk of broccoli.  I had the Bourbon chicken meal with 2 sides for $11.  Again a HUGE disappointment with the dry 4oz chicken and undercooked broccoli. The mac and cheese is the only good thing that we had and that was for my toddler.  The server only returned 1 time during the entire meal to get us drinks and continued to forget items that we had requested.  The only timely thing he provided was the check.  For future reference, this Friday's may be a good place for beer and appetizers only. We'll never know since we never tasted them.
Great food but bad employees.  The plates were dirty and my waitress was wearing a dirty outfit.  She smelled like weed

Nice place to hang out for a beer. The wing is spicy as it says in the menu. It's not like some places that they tell you it's spicy and yet it comes out mild. The bartenders are chill and makes their regulars well recognized and served well. They will need to work on new customers though.
Been sitting here for 30 minutes waiting on a simple salad and some Cajun chicken pasta.  Also been waiting over 10 minutes for a water top up.  Steer clear of this place.

Went for lunch yesterday.  No one was at the door when we came in, after we were seated it took a bit of time for the server to show up.... food order OMG we should have left it took so long.  We COULD have walked on the bill, we had to ask another server to get ours so we could get a bill.  This is the usual situation when we go there to the Worldgate store for lunch.  NOT a good place to go if you have a meeting in NINETY minutes...does not cater to working people though that is who their patrons are.  I just don't get it.

We sat outside and the area was clean. We ordered the $10 endless appetizers. Our waiter was very pleasant and checked on us continously (I think his name was Matt). Would definitely go back before the deal is over.

The service was terrible. I never even was given the chance to ask for a glass of water, because my server didn't even bring my food out. The food itself was some of the most bland I've ever had from a restaurant. Pretty terrible overall. Given the number of other options, do yourself a favor and go somewhere else.

As others mentioned, service is slow. That's not the only problem though. I ordered the Philly Stack Burger. The menu description sounded amazing. In reality, this $12 burger was less appealing than those served at your corner fast food restaurant. Here is the breakdown: The burger was supposed to come with 2 patties, bacon, onions, roasted peppers, sauce and cheese.  The 2 patties ended up being two paper thin slices of beef (both stacked together would barely equal a McDonald's burger that you can get for $1.00).  The peppers were almost non-existent and the cheese looked microwaved.  The bacon was not fresh, and I could tell it was cooked long before I received it.  There was no sauce on the buns and the lettuce and tomato didn't appear fresh. The fries were even subpar.  To make matters worse, they even screwed up my caesar salad ($3.60 extra).  I complained and showed the waiter how horrible the burger looked inside.  Instead of comping the whole meal and apologizing, he tried to defend the restaurant and charged me for the salad.  I highly recommend that you skip Fridays and go across the road to Houlighans instead.
Unfortunately, the food was mediocre, at best. However, we had an amazing server, named Solomon. He was everything a good waiter should be and more. He made the experience enjoyable.
Good stuff. Your regular all American fare. I would definitely go for the happy hour specials. You can't beat half off appetizers-especially the buffalo chicken flatbread.
Great food and service. Convenient location.  Nice outdoor seating. Prices are always reasonable.
I am currently at tgif and my server is so rude took 20 mins to greet our table! We haven't even got our drinks and its been 10 more mins. This is ridiculous!!!

I haven't been to a T.G.I. Friday's in ages and really never thought of it as anything other than a happy hour spot. I was pleasantly surprised at how much better it's gotten, though, which is why I felt compelled to write this very review. :) The Grilled Chicken Cobb Salad was delicious and was a very generous portion. The service was great - the food came out promptly and our waiter was friendly and accommodating. I left a happy camper.

I figure it's about time I write a review for this restaurant as I come here at least once a month. Service is ok. The waiters/waitresses aren't overly friendly but they get the job done. Food is pretty good, enough for us to come back every few weeks. This place is never really crowded, which works for us as we have a toddler, we want a place that is family friendly, and allows us to get in and out before a tantrum occurs. Right now they ask you to complete a survey after each visit, if you do you'll get a free appetizer your next visit. I love free food!

The only time I come to this location is before i go watch a movie at Worldgate theatres. The service from the waitstaff is average. I normally prefer servers that get me what i need (refills, napkins, etc) without bugging me all the time, on that note, I had to ask for my refills everytime. The food is average as well. One of the appetizer that i tried was the buffalo wings tossed in BBQ sauce. It was dry and only half my wings had sauce on it. The big party table that was next to us was way too close for comfort. I know its not their fault, but the tables put together was very close to the booths where we were sitted, otherwise the kids that were at the table shouting wouldnt have been as annoying as it was. Other than that, one of my favorite dessert is here, the vanilla bean cheesecake. That is something that I always get when i go to a TGIF's. If it wasnt for the movie theatre, I most likely would not choose this place to eat.

Alright so I have started coming here recently after a few years of not going to Fridays, and their new meal options are great. Being a picky eater I dont normally go for what real people would call food, that being said, Fridays now seems to offer adult oriented food that even appeals to me. The location isnt too bad although you will most likely have to park in the garage. It can get a bit loud at times although i have only been there on friday evenings (just works out that way). Not really sure about the temperature, it tends to be on the chillier side so you might want to bring a light jacket if you tend to be cold. The staff seem to be helpful. Pricing is rather reasonable for the food and they have some good options available. As with most restaurants like this you can expect to pay ~$6 on up for anything alcoholic.  They do seem to haev coupons everywhere at the moment though so you can get some really good discounts, most likely wont last though since they are busy trying to advertise the "new" Fridays. Overall i recommend hitting this place up if you are looking for something decent without spending too much.

If you are looking for a cheap lunch than you really can't beat Fridays.  They offer a lunch menu with burgers and salads.  If you do it right you can get out for $10 or so.   The service here is fast and the people are friendly.  If you are coming for lunch you want to get there a little earlier, the parking at World Gate can be a bear sometimes. I figure I should write a review now.  I've now been here 3 times in two months so I guess its due.  The first time I ordered the Bacon Cheeseburger from the lunch menu.  They cooked it more than the medium that I requested but that was o.k.  The burger itself actually had some decent flavor as did the fries.  The next two times I ordered the all you can east salad and soup combo.  Not too shabby for $7 bucks.  For $7 bucks you also get a soda.  The clam chowder is good as is the broccoli cheese soup.  Those were the only two soups they had available those days.  As for the salad, you really can't mess that up.  The Cesar salad is good and not over dressed with the dressing.  And the best part ALL YOU CAN EAT =).   I have had other things here but those are just your typical chain type of foods.  Wings, steaks, ribs, and so on. The food here really isn't that bad, but things can get pricy if you come for dinner.  So if you want a cheap and fast lunch then this is one of your best bets.  So why the 4 stars for this chain restaurant?  Why not, the food I had was good, the service was good, and the price was just right =)  Oh yeah, this is only for the lunch rush.  I have not had dinner at this location yet.

worst experience ever. my friend and I ordered some food to go took forever. then we looked in our bag and the mashed potatoes face down in the bag. After they replaced that, we got home my burger was so burnt the dog wouldn't even eat it and it didn't come with any sauce. then the appetizer didn't come with any chips like it said if would. Spent $50 on shit we had to throw away

Average food at average prices. That is all of what is to be said about tgif. I came here for happy hour specials a few times. I thought I was getting a great deal for 4 dollar mogitos and long islands. They are that much because the drinks are watered down completely. Their shrimp pasta Alfredo is good. Jack Daniels burger is ok. I'm not a big fan of tgif though. I guess that's why I hadn't been there for years before trying them out again.

This is one of our regular stops. I am impressed with their effort to provide some heart healthy menu alternatives such as the dragofire chicken/salmon. I am less impressed wth the salads and sandwhiches. For dessert, get the vanilla cheesecake

Ehh.  I'd say they're about on par with American Cafe.  Used to come here a lot during high school when I lived at the apartment complex across the street.  Two and a half stars.  I'm tempted to give a three once I saw their twice a week happy hour prices on blue moon drafts.  The BFF had the cheesy bacon cheeseburger which came with too much in the way of burger veggies, and somewhat bland french fries.  My pork chop was cooked well if a little too charred, with mashed potatoes that were a little too thin in texture.  Onion rings were okay, if smaller than I'm used to.  Service was extra prompt since it was close to closing, but I feel bad for not noticing that they overchanged us til we got home.  Yay for buy one get one free coupons.

I feel like this place is an extreme waste of money anymore. When I was a child I used to like it. Now I can go to the grocery store buy the same stuff, come home cook it and it tastes exactly the same as if I was to eat at the "restaurant" myself. The staff there at most of the ones I have dinner at look to put it nicely, we'll just not people I would like to be served by.

We hadn't been to this (or any other) TGI Friday's in years.   My dad, who was visiting us, said that he would like to go here---so off we went on a Monday night around 5:30 p.m. We were immediately seated and appreciated getting a good sized table so we didn't feel cramped.  Our server was prompt, friendly and efficient.   When ordering drinks, I noticed that Friday's now has slushie-type non alcoholic drinks.  I ordered a peach mango one and did enjoy it.  My dad got a soda while my husband had non-alcoholic beer. For entrees, I got the half rack of baby back ribs which came with ginger slaw and "seasoned fries".  The ribs were properly cooked and the meat was falling off the bone.  The sauce had some kick to it which gave the ribs a nice flavor.  The slaw had too much dressing but was still edible---nothing to write home about but no complaints either.  The seasoned fries were at their best when eaten when they were still hot. My husband and my dad both got the petite sirloin, with my dad topping his with lobster sauce.  When they say "petite", they mean it---it's a small, thin piece of meat.  Both got their sirloins cooked properly.  My husband said that it was a tough little steak.  I reminded him that this wasn't a steakhouse plus it wasn't expensive so you get what you pay for.  Still, both of them finished their meals. To sum it up --- Friday's is the type of place where you can expect to get your money's worth and find decent, if not remarkable food.  Yet it's not the type of place where you dream about going back to very soon.  That said, no doubt we will return at some point.

I will NOT be eating at this Friday's again. My colleague saw a mouse scurry across the dining room floor and the manager did not act like he cared at all. Our waiter seemed concerned but had to go back and request the manager's presence TWICE.  Once he did come out, he was not worried or remorseful. He told us (in a hushed voice) that the mouse comes in from the outside, he was aware and is taking care of it. I would have been grossed out without this reaction, but I understand that it can happen because restaurants are mice magnets. His reaction was inexcusable, however. It did not make me feel confident that he would do anything about it ever. If I were a manager, I would act apologetic and offer a discount or comped a dessert (I have been offered that for less). I would assure my customer that it is a priority to remove the mouse.  I am not a complainer (this is my first Yelp review) and I only bring something to the manager's attention if I feel I cannot keep it quiet (I received the aforementioned dessert because we found a label in our nachos). I WILL NOT be going back there.  Also, our waiter was pleasant but the food was very slow and we were on a lunch break. Not worth the $15 I spent on two apps, tax and a tip. I could've gotten two Chipotle burritos.

I can't say much good or bad about this visit.  I simply placed an order for their bbq chicken flatbread and went back to my office. What I can say is that the hostess greeted me, told me how much it was, went to get the food and didn't come back with my change.  That was going to require extra time, which obviously I didn't have in the first place.  I finally just told her not to worry about it and left. Scam for tips?  Unorganized?  You decide...

Umm just no. The food has either gone frozen downhill or this location is majorly lacking. Felt like our food was just warmed up and took forever to get anything. Last straw was when a mouse ran across the floor by our booth. Haven't been back.

Decided to go to here on 06/23/13 because my wife nor I felt like cooking and wanted to go somewhere with reasonably priced food.  Sorry we weren't that impressed by this place.  My wife and I went to this restaurant before and we weren't satisfied but that was a long time ago and long before I even heard of Yelp. I honestly feel like this Friday's menu needs to be consolidated or reorganized. They had a lot of stuff on the menu which only confused me. At least the menu should of had a specialty section, that showed me the items they were experts at making, but it didn't.  I also feel like they should denote on their menu which food items are spicy. I say that because my wife isn't a fan of spicy foods so the item she ordered she couldn't enjoy it because it was spicy. She explained to me that it didn't taste bad but she just couldn't enjoy it. It was the same for me, for the item I ordered  however, I'm not bothered by spicy foods so it wasn't as bad for me.  Our server was a little slow at times which was weird because we were here on a Sunday during lunch hours so the restaurant wasn't packed at all.  I don't know what it is about Friday's but no matter what, it seems that our experience is never really that pleasant.  I don't know maybe this place is better for happy hour. The food isn't bad it's just we would like better service and at least someone explain to us that we are ordering an entrée that is spicy since it isn't denoted in the huge menu.  I think I'll be staying away from Friday's for a while unless it's for happy hour or someone begs me.

Service should be better than what was experienced on a slow night. With how long service took, you would expect the place to be extremely busy. When asked for no cheese on the burger, only one of the cheeses was taken off and wait staff was acting like I only asked for that particular cheese to come off. Will not be returning due to the disappointing wait staff, and that says a lot coming from one who went enough times to a T.G.I. Friday's back out in California.

Your regular TGIF spot, that is located in the Worldgate center. Great happy hour specials if your looking for a place for well priced drinks. Also have great specials on appitizers (half priced). Believe You must sit at bar near, bar area, or patio to get prices tho. They service is ok. They are generally pretty busy on Friday afternoons, with a well mixed crowd. Also there is an outside sitting area if nice day and you wish to sit outside.

I guess I shouldn't have high expectations for Friday's. Service is what can be expected. Ours waiter was rushing and forgetting to bring back items we asked for. We started off with the appetizer plater, the potatoes skins (basically a glop of cheddar and 3 crumbles of bacon on a potato..gross, wings which my friends had no complaints of same with the green bean fries. For the entree I had the chicken bruschetta pasta and asked for an Alfredo sauce instead of marinara, and a side of Mac n cheese. The pasta was undercooked and the chicken over cooked. And the Mac n cheese was plain disgusting. My other friend had the ribs which were actually really good, not fall off the bone good but you get the point. My other friend had chicken tenders, a simple dish that was also to her liking. I guess I just picked he wrong items. Still wouldn't return to this location.

I travel a lot and hit a lot of Fridays.  This one is below the Fridays average.  The bar staff and manager are more absorbed in talking to each other rather than providing good service or cleaning the bar.   Not coming back to this one.

I guess you can't expect too much from a local hangout that has been around forever.  But service is just not really consistent.  Sometimes we get an awesome server that knows if he takes care of us we will tip accordingly.  But most of the time ie., the last 2 years service has been dismal at best.  We are always better off just sitting at the bar.  UGH

Food is good, typical for a chain restaurant, but the service leaves a bit to be desired. Waitresses were good, although one was to chummy for my liking, but the bartenders really fall short of the mark. Slow to engage you after sitting down, slow to take your order, slow to check on you and even getting the check took a considerable amount of time. They seemed to be preoccupied, with what I don't know, and you'll need to speak up to get service.

I think this Fridays is the best looking restaurant ever. However, I went to the restaurant thinking it would be at least decent it was okay. The waitress didn't come over for 15 minutes thank goodness our hostess took our order instead and he was amazing. The appetizers were good and the jack daniels was okay but my chicken was burnt all over.

Came here for happy hour and appetizers with the wifey and friends.  Had a blast, TGIF has a nice environment and atmosphere that makes your experience better.  The servers are also friendly.  I was drinking Bud Lights draft for 2 bucks!!!  They also have $4 mojitos, long islands, and margarita's.  The appetizers are half off during happy hour as well.   This location has the bar centrally located in the center of the restaurant which I though is pretty cool, kind of like saying "center of the party, right here".  They also have booths close by and tables if the bar scene is not for you on that particular night or you are out with your family.   The food has always been great when I do come here to dine in.  It always seems that at TGIF, they always have some specials going on which help you save on your bill.  Desserts are to die for at this place.  Not only is the presentation great, but the dish itself is amazing!!!.   Great place to bring family and or friends!!

Burgers & Fries a Delicious combination that many know and love. This place makes pretty good food. Now I haven't tried that much of the stuff on the menu, but I have yet to be disappointed here. I came here on various occasions and all times I was happy with everything. Yes, including the service. The service I receive here is always friendly and polite not to mention quick too. I will defiantly continue to come to this place when ever I'm in the area with friends again. I find this place best with at least two or more people.  Now this place is clean and not just the eating area. The bathrooms are always in good working order which is good and expected from a food chain like this one. Now if your coming to the bar expect great service because that's what you'll get, or so that is what I got. The only down side to this place well isn't really a down side just more over a personal dislike is the stairs thing they have by the bar. however in all reality that isn't even a downside. I just hate dealing with stairs while I'm in heels if you catch my drift ladies. Aside from that I am very happy with this place.

I haven't been to a friday's in years, literally.  I went to this one for lunch with some guys from work, and was very pleasantly surprised. First up, we found a coupon online at   - free entree. Second, they are giving away $10 gift cards when you buy one of the 20 new items on their menu (good for your next visit). Third, the new burgers are damn good, nice work Friday's. Fourth, $13 can get you an appetizer, entree (within limits), and a desert, pretty nice. FYI: The wedge is seriously a head of lettuce, i warned you. ha. The bad: salty as hell french fries... ha.  Also service was a bit slow, but they were busy, so it's understandable. Anyway, Friday's used to get a 1 in my book, but after this trip - I've upgraded it to a 3. ha.

This is my second time coming to this Fridays and both times my servers were no better than the average "meh"... I work right next door and I send customers there all the time confident that they'll get great service but now that'll have to come with a warning... Our server was Rachel and after a rushed intro, a mention of happy hour but not of what it included, 2drinks in before an appetizer, I watched as customers that just asked me if Fridays were open were treated rudely when asking for Cindy with a y... I was completely floored when her answer was "I don't know her schedule its not my job to keep track of her" even my customers commented on her rudeness... thank God another server came in and saved their meal as they were contemplating leaving. My husband and I won't be back and Fridays will now be on my last list of recommendations...

Food was very good. Do not sit at the bar. I sat there because I was dining alone. I was ignored by two Friday servers. They passed me by five times, I watched them remove empty glasses from my left. I watched the male bartender (jorge) interact with the couple next to me. I feel like I was practically raising my hand for him to see me. He took my order and he didn't even look in my direction till I was well into eating my food. He asked how it tasted. I told him it was good. I finished my food...waited...waited...waited... Then when my brain was telling me to just leave some money on the bar top and walk away he came by and I asked for the bill. Keep in mind my plate had been cleared for a while at this point and my long island was empty. I had my credit card out and I actually waved it at him to get his attention. You would think that he would just take my card since it was on the bar top right next to where he placed the receipt. I think that action may have been on purpose. He didn't have any problem being social with others. I think if you want a sports book experience you will be fine. He made two bets with other patrons, maybe three. One patron even said " I never bet, every time I see you I'm betting " jorge you ignored me but I noticed everything. Jorge might not be his name because he never introduced himself nor was he wearing a name tag but the receipt said jorge.

We go when it's not too busy- usually lunch on a weekend. Love their beer batter cheese with pretzel bread, lettuce wedge salad, black bean burger, great whiskey cake. During the summer we enjoy sitting outside.

Hey, they cleaned up! I haven't been in a Friday's in a long time, and came here twice recently for work-related "activities".  I noticed that unlike a couple years ago, there is no more sticky grime on the floor, and does not smell like sweaty tees any more.  Of course, there's still the smoke reminent that you need to ensure, but that's a big step up from what it was offering. Now, the food is alright, nothing fancy, nothing spectacular, but quite edible.  Out of all offerings, I think my favorite is the Jack Daniels chicken strips.  DO NOT TRY THEIR MAHI-MAHI -- They have no idea how to cook fish.  But what really shines is the cheap drinks; happy hour on-tap starts at 2 bucks (1 @ $2, 1 @ $3 rotates every day of the week), although the $2 variety are usually "Lite" beers - hey, better than ice-tea, right?

The food at this Friday's location is good . . . whenver you can get it.  I have to say, I've visited this location several times since it's close to work.  Each time just hoping something would be different.  That's been insanity because each time, I believe the service gets even slower.  I've tried going early (around 11:30am), I've tried going later in the lunch rush hour (12:30 - 12:45pm).  No difference, service is still slow.  If you have time to kill, then this TGI Fridays is the place for you.

Went there for happy hour on a weeknight.  Sat at the bar, waited several minutes for a single bartender to greet us - there were 3 females tenders and each passed us at least 3 times.  Not the friendliest staff.  Didn't see smiles or enthusiastic characters.  Didn't checked on us once to see if we needed anything else.     Happy Hour runs until 9pm.  $2 ML, BL, CL; $3 BM, and all Sams and $4 Margaritas and Mojitos.  1/2 certain apps. Atmosphere was bland.  Very dark and heavy feeling in the restaurant.  Bar area is tiny and this place looks like a commuter bar.  People step in for a beer and then leave immediately after.  Not a place to mingle amongst the patrons nor the staff! Try at your own risk.  Not a fan of the food and probably won't be revisiting this establishment any time soon.

I usually LOVE TGI Fridays, but this one was mediocure.  I went for lunch and although the service was good, the food wasn't the greatest.  Most the people at the table (there were 8 of us), said they had had better at other Friday restaurants.  I will be taking this place off my list for food, but add it for Happy Hour.

I rarely go to Friday's, service is hit and miss, so is the food.  This time, service was good.  Food was confusing.  We ordered the $10 special, my BF got the pulled pork bbq (which he says is ok), I got the korean tacos (more on that in a minute), he got the "beef" queso appetizer and I got the peanut butter pie (we split those two items).  I also got the strawberry lemonade slushy.  What I got was a lot of strawberry something, no lemonade that I could tell, poored over some crushed ice, it wasn't even cold.  Just weird.  The queso was pretty good but the "beef" was a small spoonful of what tasted like Hormel no bean chili.  It was good but not exactly what we were expecting.  Which brings me to the Korean tacos.  First, they say they are korean bbq beef.  There were 3 very small pieces of beef in each taco (you get more meat at Taco Bell, no lie).  The asian lime/cilantro/ginger slaw?  It was very soggy and cooked lettuce, with way too much of some flavorless dressing, which poured out of the tortillas, there was so much, you couldn't even pick up the tortilla to eat it, it had a couple of shreds of carrot and a chunk of cucumber.  If there was ginger, lime or cilantro in there, it was definitely hiding.  And this was in no way slaw.  It was salad.  And not even a good one.  I do not like cooked lettuce so I picked it off and just ate the 3 pieces of meat per taco.  Couldn't even eat the tortillas as they turned to mush.  Thankfully, I filled up on the queso and since it was about a gazillion degrees, I wasn't that hungry anyway.  I really would have liked a cold slushie, though.   Anyway, keep expectations low and you'll do ok.  And don't go during a busy time, the service will be non-existent.  If you go during a slow period, it's pretty good.   We'll probably go back, we go there about every six months or so, just for something different.  But I ask myself Why every time.
Although we mentioned we didnt eat pork, we got pork dumplimgs. The steak felt like we were eating a piece of wood. Burger was quite OK.

Today at lunch I was getting fired up, I mean FIRED UP, to write a scathing review about the consistenly bad service at this location. Then something happened.  My coworkers let another waitress know that we had been waiting for-EVER for our drinks, and all of a sudden our formerly suckin' waitress was much more on the money.   Of course, our appetizer plates that we requested arrived long after we had finally given up and devoured the appetizers straight from the serving dishes.  But that was before the service picked up. I have to give the waitress points for remembering my order of the salad, considering my detox diet requires that I ask for all the fun stuff to be removed from food.   The menu ain't half bad for a chain joint.  They've got some decently priced healthy lunch entrees near the back of the menu that tase a-ok. It's still a godawful chain, in my opinion, but one that my meat-loving coworkers enjoy.  And their company makes it worthwhile. Vegans beware: almost nothing on the menu, save for the fries, will fit your bill.

I'm not sure if I actually got the 3 for whatever special.  I wasn't paying so i didn't see the bill and I didn't have full confidence that it was right.  The place was really busy but the service kept up with it decently.  Bathrooms were clean and the atmosphere high, and food the quality you'd expect from TGIFridays.

TGI Friday's is the same just about everywhere you go. In Virginia, it's a bit smokier than most, but the people that work there are pleasant and the food is average, but you always know what to expect. If you like your steak rare, this is probably not the place for you. It took multiple attempts on the part of the cook to come up with something that my co-worker would even eat. But, I have to say, the Championship NY Strip with the cheddar mashed potatoes is worth strolling in for. The Gourmet Mac n Cheese, not so much. But, this place always has great drink specials and a nice long happy hour until 9pm, so I'm sure I will find myself here again when in town.

It's okay- they don't have very many nice servers- actually, we've never had a nice one at this location.  The bartenders and pretty nice on Sundays during the football games, but the servers get mad if you don't order enough food and give you an attitude, which I think is unacceptable when they place is empty.  The food is okay, but the service is lacking.
